title: Cable Jointer
description:
Are you an experienced Cable Jointer or Electrician looking for a new challenge?
Keen on a role with a proven company and a great team?
We have an amazing opportunity for you!
​
About us
Northpower is an electricity and fibre network provider for Whangarei and Kaipara, with more than 60,000 connected customers. We also provide contracting services to our partners – other network owners and operators across the North Island.
We have over 1,000 staff working together across 13 locations to keep the power on and the lights going for our customers.
The role
As a Cable Jointer with Northpower, this will see you working in a varied role where you will be undertaking cable location, fault location, testing of new and repaired cables and high voltage switching. Assist cable faults team and providing system information and cable locations as required.  You’ll be part of an on call roster carrying out standover duties.
What we’re offering
An opportunity to gain new skills within the electricity distribution industry
An interesting role within a great team
The chance to work with a company who puts our people at the heart of the organisation and is committed to safety
Competitive remuneration, an in-house wellbeing programme and initiatives including group discounted medical insurance
Who we’re looking for
To be considered for this role you’ll need to be an experienced Cable Jointer with EWRB registration and a current practising licence, along with a current drivers licence (Class 1).
You will need to demonstrate the following:
Experience with Jointing XLPE / PILC and STA cables up to and including 33kV
Sound technical knowledge of cables and local network systems, procedures and standards
Great verbal and written communication skills, with basic technology knowledge
A strong commitment to health and safety
A great attitude and a willingness to be part of a team
Experience with cable testing and/or switching at high voltage (desirable but not essential)
Experience with Vector and/or Transpower networks (desirable but not essential)
Get in touch!
We’d love to hear from team players who fit the above criteria and have a great ‘can do’ attitude
Due to current border restrictions, unfortunately applications from international candidates or those without the right to work in New Zealand cannot be considered. 
Northpower has an in-house recruitment team who manage recruitment for all our vacancies.  If you're interested in a role with us we would encourage you to apply directly online to us, as we don't accept candidates via agency (unless the role is advertised by the agency at our request).
